intro: Coccoloba humboldtii var. longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-lobed coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the cashew family, Anacardiaceae. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it thrives in moist, tropical environments. The varietal form longipedicellata is distinguished by its elongated pedicels and distinctive leaf morphology.
